metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3116 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Heimdal Software Kerberos 5 implementation is vulnerable to a null pointer dereferance. An attacker with network access to an application that depends on the vulnerable code path can cause the application to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
heimdal-kcm - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
heimdal-kdc - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
heimdal-multidev - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
heimdal-servers - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libasn1-8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libgssapi3-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libhcrypto4-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libhdb9-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libheimbase1-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libheimntlm0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libhx509-5-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libkadm5clnt7-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libkadm5srv8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libkafs0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libkdc2-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libkrb5-26-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libotp0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libroken18-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libsl0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libwind0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> VU#730793 believed to to be fixed by 7a19658c1 ("spnego: Fix NULL deref") believed to be introduced by b53c90da0 ("Make error reporting somewhat more correct for SPNEGO.") samba contains an embedded code copy of heimdal, but does not use heimdal for SPNEGO

criterions.comment: heimdal package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
